result.execSummary:
The defendant Bjorn J Haugen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: - Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or call the Clerk of Courts Office (920-294-4142) to set-up a payment plan.
- Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Bjorn J Haugen

records.addlTxt:
3:40 PM Defendant Bjorn J Haugen in court.  Attorney Gerise Laspisa in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant states he'd like to accept the offer. DA Laspisa recites offer - plea to count 1, fine and costs and DNA, count 2 will be dismissed and read in. Court instructs defendant of his/her right to counsel. Defendant waives right to counsel. Court accepts waiver. Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST.

Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights. Court goes over the elements of each offense. Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty. Court instructs defendant regarding deportation. 

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST. Court finds the plea is made knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently. Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea. Court finds the defendant guilty on count 1 and will dismiss and read in count 2. Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today. Sentencing statement by DA Laspisa. No statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

-Court costs. Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or call the Clerk of Courts Office (920-294-4142) to set-up a payment plan. 
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample. 


Court adjourned at  3:45 PM
Second appearance on October 24, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

NOT ON THE RECORD 

Defendant Bjorn J Haugen in court.  Attorney Matthew Steven McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant states he moved into with one of his coworkers but does not have his current address memorized yet. Defendant is looking to get an attorney but has a hard time getting in contact with one due to his work hours. Court notes defendant has a warrant out of Marquette County. Court sets Status of Counsel for October 24, 2022 at 3:00 PM. Defendant is taken into custody.
Second appearance on October 4, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Letter to the Court from defendant's employer dated September 6, 2022 re: reasons why defendant missed his court appearance

Second appearance on September 6, 2022 at 10:00 am.

ADA recites offer, upon plea to count 2 will recommend a fine, costs and DNA sample and will dismiss and read-in count 2. Defendant requests time to think about it. Court sets for Status Hearing on July 12, 2022 at 10:00 A.M.

Court adjourned at 10:09 AM
Status hearing scheduled for July 12, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Status hearing on July 12, 2022 at 10:00 am.

10:17 AM Defendant Bjorn J Haugen in court.  Attorney Matthew Steven McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin. Def states he has not yet obtained an attorney and requests more time. Court adjourned second appearance to May 31, 2022 at 10:00 AM. 

Court adjourned at 10:17 AM.
Second appearance scheduled for May 31, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Status hearing on May 31, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Second appearance on April 26, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.
Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.

9:14 AM Defendant Bjorn J Haugen in court.  Attorney Matthew Steven McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading. Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count. Court finds probable cause. Court instructs the defendant of his/her right to an attorney. Def requests an attorney. ADA McElroy makes bond recommendation. Court sets bond at $500 signature bond and conditions of: Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department. Court will set for Status of Counsel April 26 at 10:00 AM.

Court adjourned at 9:16 AM.
